title: Which country is the best for drone manufacturing? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re asking about the ‘small unmanned aviation system’ kind of drone under 55 pounds, right now it seems to be China that makes the best. DJI’s pretty much regarded as the best at every price point and they’ve got something like 85% of the market for GPS and vision stabilized ‘pro-sumer’ drones like Phantoms and Mavics, plus the professional and enterprise Mavic 2 versions and their Matrice and Agra lines. Their new Mavic Mini is the most capable drone under 250 grams and is flying off the shelves just a few days after its release on 11/11/19. I don’t know all the reasons why China’s the best now, might be because of some of the sticking points in the trade negotiations. Or, for drones it might be because they’re smart, lots of dedicated and talented engineers, lots of smart hands to build stuff, and they got into the market with the best product as they were moving way past ‘developing nation’ status and have developed into a manufacturing juggernaut where the government’s a partner in every concern. EMAX, Beta, and other FPV/racing drones are Chinese, too, and are amazing for what they do for the price. Yuneec’s Chinese, may be in trouble. The Yuneec pilot’s forum has lots of complaints with service. It took me nearly six months to get an $1800 thermal camera I crashed repaired while the dealer waited for parts. They don’t seem to be much competition for DJI, don’t have good 3rd party apps like Litchi or DroneDeploy. Parrot’s French, and IMHO their Bebops are toy drones and the Anafi may be too. They’d need years of building better drones to convince me to buy another Parrot. Draganflyer’s Canadian and they’re what I started with years ago, but they’re geared toward enterprise and first responder markets and and have nothing I can afford or want for what I do. Autel Robotics is US-based with their EVO, but Chinese owned, has some following but gets reviews like ‘too little too late’. Some people like them because they don’t do geofencing. I haven’t had an EVO, don’t need one, don’t mind being geo-fenced. Skydio is a US company, looks like their Skydio 2 might challenge the Mavic Platinum and Mavic 2 in some ways, but we’re a long way off of whatever they might do next. I pre-ordered mine the day after they released and am now waiting for production run 3, some time in the Spring of 2020. They’re not going to beat anybody at market share if they can’t deliver, and I wish them the best. Some articles make me think they’re wanting to get into autonomous delivery/survey drones as soon as the US decides on the systems for drone traffic management.
